channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The U.S. is considering redirecting military equipment once bound for Afghanistan to Ukraine to reinforce its defenses against Russia, officials said https://t.co/TwotInRSeg
A gang called the Zouk family is running wild in Singapore. They are otters. “They aren’t nice little puppies.” https://t.co/bnkJSOXmZf
Millennials’ growing appetite for homeownership is boosting demand for housing that economists think will remain strong for years, explains @davidhodari #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/a76VOyWWD2
Knowing two languages makes you better at learning other languages, new research shows—and it also alters how you think https://t.co/w08nuJWdwp

A federal judge overturned a roughly $4.5 billion settlement between OxyContin maker Purdue and members of the Sackler family who own the drugmaker, a surprising decision that raises questions about the future of the company and its owners https://t.co/PnCb549Zki
A gang called the Zouk family is running wild in Singapore. They are otters. “They aren’t nice little puppies.” https://t.co/ccTWELjJYJ
The FDA is allowing women to get the abortion pill mifepristone by mail, lifting a requirement that they must go to a medical office or hospital to get it https://t.co/wyWmxtCfBs

Bruce Springsteen sold his music rights to Sony Music Entertainment for around $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter. The deal is the largest transaction ever for the life’s work of an individual artist. https://t.co/I32Vd4RecL
CDC advisers recommended adults take Pfizer or Moderna Covid vaccines over Johnson & Johnson’s due to a risk of rare clotting cases tied to the J&J shot https://t.co/MrUu8BgBeS
Haitian kidnappers released the remaining 12 missionary hostages abducted two months ago. Five others had been freed earlier. https://t.co/U9mG8DqZ8b

German officials are growing worried about the radicalization of some antivaccine militants as the country edges toward a general Covid-19 vaccine mandate that could come early next year https://t.co/6ZT4MOSacr

From @WSJopinion: Some 30 major cities across the U.S. are recording record or near-record homicides this year, writes @DanHenninger. Maybe voters are starting to regret the consequences of electing progressive prosecutors. https://t.co/CJJPbRYjfZ

German officials are growing worried about the radicalization of some antivaccine militants as the country edges toward a general Covid-19 vaccine mandate that could come early next year https://t.co/EW6upqjm7R
Reddit says it has confidentially filed paperwork with the SEC to begin the process of going public https://t.co/TQU87ILi49
“The science on lead is settled—there is no safe level of exposure”: The White House is set to announce a plan to help millions of U.S. households replace lead water pipes https://t.co/IIm6vV7Qky

Surging Covid-19 infections, hospitalizations and deaths are prompting South Korea to reverse plans to reopen and instead take some of the most aggressive measures against the virus of any country in the world https://t.co/AwDUEv44X2
The Jacksonville Jaguars fired Urban Meyer, ending his tumultuous NFL tenure after just 13 games https://t.co/FisPOUX734
Most Fed officials signaled they were prepared to raise rates at least three times next year to cool high inflation https://t.co/kkkOEFTTQy
President Biden will nominate Caroline Kennedy to be U.S. ambassador to Australia, the White House said Wednesday https://t.co/pplUHNOAh9

From @WSJopinion: Whether war breaks out will depend on how badly Beijing and Moscow fear the global power shift in the next decade and how eager they will be to exploit their perceived current relative advantages to remake the world, writes @andrewmichta https://t.co/CwCfJH1Yuq
During the pandemic, the number of people moving to California fell 38%, a new study found. In the San Francisco Bay Area, new arrivals plummeted 45% https://t.co/9XVLV6m1t7

The Democratic-controlled House has voted to hold Trump’s final chief of staff, Mark Meadows, in criminal contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena to testify to the panel investigating the Capitol riot https://t.co/1zzjK1p3t6
President Biden will nominate Caroline Kennedy to be U.S. ambassador to Australia, the White House said Wednesday https://t.co/XXhAtoIXv4

The House panel investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol voted to recommend holding Mark Meadows, Donald Trump's final chief of staff, in criminal contempt of Congress for defying a congressional subpoena https://t.co/fkKYXeV4m5

Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, agreed to rebuff Western intrusion into their countries’ internal affairs and boost efforts to defend their nations’ security interests https://t.co/LC84DnH09n
Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk and Sen. Elizabeth Warren clashed with one another on Twitter after the senator called on the billionaire chief executive to pay more taxes https://t.co/CKNuNbIDBO

Elon Musk and Elizabeth Warren clashed on Twitter after the U.S. senator tweeted: “Let’s change the rigged tax code so The Person of the Year will actually pay taxes and stop freeloading off everyone else.” https://t.co/nAClI3Unc1
Stephen Curry broke the NBA record for career 3-pointers by making his 2,974th on Tuesday night. Here’s how he shot his way into history. https://t.co/6xMMAMIIlu
Andrew Cuomo must relinquish millions of dollars he made on his Covid-era memoir when he was New York governor, a state ethics watchdog ordered https://t.co/QjrZyXpZeP
The song ‘1-800-273-8255’—the national suicide prevention hotline—and Logic’s ensuing performances led to higher call volume and decrease in suicides, research shows https://t.co/9xtGEmLxNY

Pfizer’s Covid-19 pill, which is up for FDA authorization, worked against Omicron in lab tests, the company said. A final analysis of a key study also confirmed the drug was 89% effective in high-risk adults. https://t.co/2lfPU7arih
The House voted unanimously to ban imports from China’s Xinjiang over concerns about the use of forced labor https://t.co/vvJEDLJJrO
The House is preparing to vote on holding Mark Meadows, former President Donald Trump’s final chief of staff, in criminal contempt of Congress https://t.co/ZVAGxf1Wne
Harvard nanoscience expert Charles Lieber goes on trial for what the government alleges were his efforts to conceal his links to the Wuhan University of Technology in China https://t.co/M7vhGHOEtI
Some big hospital systems have dropped vaccine mandates after a judge blocked a Biden administration requirement for healthcare workers to get shots https://t.co/uKOMcw3P58
Stephen Curry broke the NBA record for career 3-pointers by making his 2,974th on Tuesday night. Here’s how he shot his way into history. https://t.co/vvMBSDMUz2
Former President Donald Trump lost his bid to shield his tax returns from the House Ways and Means Committee on Tuesday, after a federal judge dismissed the case https://t.co/LP1rBfe6TZ
Apple stores across the U.S. are returning to requiring face masks as Covid-19 cases surge. The new mask mandate will apply to all customers and employees, the company said. https://t.co/GEhTyPKWnK

JPMorgan told unvaccinated employees in New York that they must work from home starting Tuesday. “It seems unfair to require our vaccinated employees to wear masks all day at their desks,” the bank said in the memo. https://t.co/N4uwhXKeg5
The U.S. Supreme Court turned down emergency requests by New York healthcare workers for a religious exemption from state requirements to vaccinate against Covid-19 https://t.co/n06BUWEXlh
Andrew Cuomo must relinquish millions of dollars he made on his Covid-era memoir when he was New York governor, a state ethics watchdog ordered https://t.co/fOaDrohDr0

The Proud Boys and Oath Keepers were sued by the District of Columbia, which alleges the far-right groups “worked together to plot, publicize, recruit for, and finance” the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol https://t.co/d8PZ1YFMDx
SenseTime, which had aimed to raise up to $767 million from the deal, says it is still committed to concluding its Hong Kong listing soon https://t.co/8EjzyUlydL
Toyota plans global sales of 3.5 million electric vehicles by 2030 and intends to make the Lexus brand 100% electric by 2035 https://t.co/CtAAq0d0HJ
Elon Musk tweeted that Tesla will make some merchandise buyable with the cryptocurrency dogecoin, which soared as much as 40% https://t.co/MgyBlk5pWu

The United Arab Emirates is threatening to pull out of a $23 billion deal to buy American-made F-35 aircraft, Reaper drones and other advanced munitions, officials said, with the U.A.E. citing onerous U.S. requirements to guard against Chinese espionage https://t.co/UCp70qQdJU
Kroger is taking away paid emergency leave for unvaccinated employees who contract Covid-19, while a $50 monthly health surcharge will be added for some staff https://t.co/16OAvXlSh1

Pfizer’s Covid-19 pill, which is up for FDA authorization, worked against Omicron in lab tests, the company said. A final analysis of a key study also confirmed the drug was 89% effective in high-risk adults. https://t.co/OCTGS8b9Qg

California will again require masking in all public indoor settings regardless of vaccination status as it confronts rising case rates ahead of the winter holidays and uncertainty about the Omicron variant https://t.co/B7AY10bnw5
A Bass Pro Shops trucker hat with a fish on it has become trendy—among people who have no interest in fishing https://t.co/L6Py5tM8Nl
